info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 4:43PM EDT until August 08 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN CHEROKEE AND SOUTHEASTERN POLK COUNTIES... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain is estimated to have fallen in the past 2 hours. Additional light rainfall amounts are possible in the warned area over the next hour. Flash flooding is possible in the next hour as runoff continues. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Ducktown, Turtletown, William L. Davenport Refuge and Hot House. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
